definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: A verb must agree with its subject in number and person.
sentences.chinese: 在数和人称方面动词必须与其主词一致。

sentences.english: In his early samples, George drops subjects about 40% of the time.
sentences.chinese: 在早期范例中，乔治漏掉主词占40%。

sentences.english: Complete sentences have a subject and a verb.
sentences.chinese: 完整的句子包含有主词和动词。

sentences.english: A substance was supposed to be the persistent subject of varying predicates.
sentences.chinese: 实体被人设想为是变化不同的谓语之永恒不变的主词。

sentences.english: The verb must agree with the subject in person and number.
sentences.chinese: 在数和人称方面动词必须与其主词一致。

sentences.english: We now go closer into the specialty of subject and predicate.
sentences.chinese: 现进一步讨论主词与谓词的特性。

sentences.english: In point of thought, the subject is primarily the individual, and the predicate the universal.
sentences.chinese: 按照它的思想来说，主词是个体，谓词是共体。

sentences.english: A sentence usually contains a subject and a verb.
sentences.chinese: 句子通常包括主词和动词。

definition: determiner (in grammar, i.e. article, demonstrative, possessive pronoun, noun genitive etc)
part of speech (noun, verb, adjective etc)/lexical category
